content: The Act may be cited as the "College Cost Reduction and Access Act Technical Amendments of 2007". Federal Pell Grants are addressed in the Act. The College Cost Reduction and Access Act Technical Amendments of 2007 include corrections and redesignations related to the Higher Education Act of 1965. This involves amending sections and redesignating paragraphs to ensure proper implementation. The College Cost Reduction and Access Act Technical Amendments of 2007 involve corrections and redesignations related to the Higher Education Act of 1965. One amendment includes allowing funds allocated for a fiscal year to remain available for the following fiscal year. SEC. 3. DEFINITION OF UNTAXED INCOME AND BENEFITS. Amendment to Section 480(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 excludes certain types of income and benefits from the definition of untaxed income, such as child tax credit, welfare benefits, earned income credit, fuel tax credit, and foreign income exclusion for federal tax purposes. The amendment to Section 480(b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 excludes specific types of income and benefits from being considered untaxed income for federal tax purposes. This change will take effect on July 1, 2009. SEC. 4. DEFINITION OF INDEPENDENT STUDENT amended to include individuals who are orphans, in foster care, or wards of the court at age 13 or older. Effective July 1, 2009. SEC. 5. INCOME-BASED REPAYMENT FOR MARRIED BORROWERS FILING SEPARATELY. SEC. 5. INCOME-BASED REPAYMENT FOR MARRIED BORROWERS FILING SEPARATELY. Amends the Higher Education Act to calculate income-based repayment for married borrowers filing separately based solely on student loan debt and adjusted gross income. SEC. 6. DEFERRAL OF LOAN REPAYMENT FOLLOWING ACTIVE DUTY. Amends the Act to include full-time National Guard duty for loan repayment deferral following active duty. SEC. 7. TEACH GRANTS. SEC. 7. TEACH GRANTS. Amends Subpart 9 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 by making various changes to sections 420L and 420M. SEC. 8. REDESIGNATION AND RELOCATION. SEC. 8. REDESIGNATION AND RELOCATION. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended by moving part J of title IV to part G of title III and redesignating section 499A as section 399A.
